995747867502428160.text:
I wish non-fiction book writers would all just agree to cut the size of their books in half. 

I’m constantly reading books full of repetition, but I have FOMO skipping parts & worry that I’ll miss some golden nugget of wisdom.

993863137408450561.text:
Fin/ The shift to digital nations will be similar to acceptance of cryptocurrency as real money. Very slowly, then one day we'll look up and see that it's become normal. 

Crazy things to think about on a typical Tuesday morning.

993863136003477506.text:
7/ But the flow of value via commerce will grow increasingly out of the gov's reach.

Massive changes are coming in how our gov's are structured. The smart ones will adapt, the others will die and it will not be pretty for their citizens.

993863134422159360.text: 6/ How will the gov survive? Likely in raising taxes on the thing they can control: land. Property taxes will increase, because the barrier to physically moving a family to another country is extremely high (physically & emotionally), and most people won't do it.

993863132652228608.text:
5/ This doesn't mean co's will stop incorporating in Delaware. Some types of co's will still need the physical asset protection that the US can offer.

But the US WILL lose tax revenue as competition with digital nations to be business friendly increases.

993863131398115328.text: 4/ Digital nations will set new laws for governing business operations in their jurisdiction, and they will be more business-friendly. Lower business taxes because there isn't a legacy political infrastructure to support.

993863130018181120.text:
3/ We are getting closer to the day when companies don't have to incorporate in any physical nation - digital nations will form.

Step 1: digital goods, distributed team, only accept non-sovereign digital currency
Step 2: agreement to abide by judgments of that jurisdiction

993863129066074112.text:
2/ Why do courts have the power to protect companies? Two reasons:

1. All co's incorporated agree to abide by the ruling of their jurisdictional courts.
2. If co has physical assets, they can be seized by the nation under which the court rules.

993863127816200192.text:
1/ Why do companies incorporate in a state like Delaware? Because of the protection they receive from the courts.

Personal liability protection, protection of brand, ability to raise investment w/out being sued.

In return for these benefits, co's pay the courts (US gov) taxes.

If so, the most important concept aside from the value itself is individuals’ ability to prove ownership of that value.

It’s clear that a better solution for protecting and managing our keys than what we have today is crucial for enabling this future.

961059621673885696.text:
Fin/ I’m not an expert, but as always enjoy asking the questions and hearing why I’m wrong. 

What are other issues with private key UX? Any interesting solutions being worked on?

961059620474249216.text: 10/ I originally thought about this based on the book Moonwalking with Einstein (about memory champions using “memory palace” imagery to memorize tons of info). Matching seed words with memorable pictures could help ppl remember their phrase.

961059618733678599.text: 9/ Using pictures instead of words for mnemonics. It’s proven that the brain remembers images better than words, and there’s potential here for enabling ppl to “recognize” their recovery phrase via pictures in a gallery rather than have it memorized as a word string.

961059617177526272.text: Another con: you have to have trusted contacts. But life is not worth living without a few truly trusted friends. Come at me, libertarians

961059615709462528.text: 8/ This could also be built like a multi-sig contract. 3 people (family, close friends) store parts of your phrase on chain & can pull down their piece only. Need 2 out of the 3 to be able to put it together, etc. Con: your trusted contacts have to remember their own password.

961059613868257281.text: 7/ Breaking up the seed phrase, encrypting & storing it in multiple smart contracts on-chain. Pro: immutable so you can’t lose it. Con: need to encrypt using something diff than a stored password or you’re in a loop. Maybe utilize hardware or biometrics here?

961059610634473473.text: 6/ But the storage problem is a real one that will require work to create a better solution. A couple of ideas that I’ve been mulling over...

961059606733746177.text: 5/ The 2nd problem is one that can be solved over time, as people learn about the benefits of truly owning their own money (or have their bank fail). It’s also a “first-world” problem that is less important in financially unstable countries.

961059604942729217.text: 4/ Second problem: peace of mind. I’d argue the average person wants a bank to trust/blame. It’s easier thinking that Chase is keeping your imaginary digital balance safe, and if it suddenly disappears in a glitch you can complain to them and they’ll put it back.

961059602967289856.text:
3/ Where do you keep the paper? In a bank deposit box? So much for being your own bank.

Somewhere in your home? Hope you remember where you put it, even though you can’t remember where you set your car keys yesterday. 

Hammer it into metal sheets & store it around the world?

961059596503863296.text: 2/ First problem: secure storage. It’s recommended to “write your seed phrase on a piece of paper and keep it in a safe place.” In the age of iPhones, how is a piece of paper the best thing we’ve got?

961059594880593920.text:
1/ With UX, I like to use the “mom test”. Would my mother be confused by this? If so, it can probably be simplified. 

If I told her she could be her own bank, but if she lost her password she would lose her money, she’d tell her beloved son to piss off

961059581895028736.text: 0/ What are the biggest problems with seed phrase/private key UX? This is a key () barrier to cryptocurrency mass appeal and use as store of value.

957828089563754496.text: Thoughts from the #cryptotwitter peanut gallery? Please tell me why this won’t work.

957828087504306176.text:
Add governance based on token holdings, and the structure gets safer. 

I’ll admit I know nothing about the legal side, so this could be totally illegal & just waiting for an SEC hammer. But maybe it isn’t!

957828085923053568.text: But I could see this working in the right scenario. People will figure out which projects have the most promise, & those token values will increase due to higher probability of revenue distribution. Higher token values will draw contributors to the project.

957828084547366912.text: There are plenty of holes in this idea. Have to figure out how to keep the founders from scamming if they have too much control over bounties or token supply (basically granting themselves a bunch of tokens). Or disappearing if the token appreciates enough & they sell out.

957828083163295744.text: Plus the payout is not reliant on a magical future liquidity event, it’s coded into the tokens via dividends or trading on exchanges.

957828081477177346.text: It starts to look a lot like stock options for early employees, with the key differences of immediate liquidity, ability to grant tokens to people without hiring them, and ability to tie tokens directly to work done.

957828080101359616.text: The tokens could easily be valued based on supply and expected future cash flow of the company- essentially a dividend discount model.

957828078700462080.text: It also is not a fully decentralized system. Some group is deciding on the bounties & therefore direction of the company. But they’re subject to the same rules - they are paid with tokens issued from bounties they claim.

957828077056397314.text: Revenue token is not a method for raising money, it’s a method for incentivizing work from contributors who believe in the potential for future profit. It’s a way to bootstrap development early on

957828075332554753.text: The token represents a claim on company revenue. A revenue manager smart contract distributes all revenue equally to each token, minus a small % to cover costs like servers etc.

957828073730330624.text: Company mints Revenue Tokens and holds them in a treasury contract. The only way to initially issue the tokens to people is via bounties for tasks done. Then tokens can be traded freely on exchanges if desired.

957828069531766784.text: I was thinking about a token structure today that I’m curious if anyone has implemented/thought about. I call it the Revenue Token, though that’s probably not the best name...

955110261966467074.text: That’s the end of my rambling. I’m just talking out of my ass, but it’s Twitter so I think you’re supposed to do that.

955110260645220353.text: IMO that is the “light side” to your “dark side” of the future. Either could happen, or something else entirely, but I agree that it’s something the builders need to keep in front of mind. What kind of world do we want to create?

955110259265298432.text: As people become more free to move throughout the world, govs start competing like companies do today. They have to become more efficient with taxes b/c they likely have less, and they put that money toward services that “consumers” aka citizens, value most.

955110257231060992.text: If they embrace crypto & shift tax models to match a new economy, they start to compete with other govs based on who can provide the best public services and infrastructure. These are things that many people desire and are willing to pay taxes for.

955110255238803457.text: This leaves the crypto citadel govs with little money & little ability to create public services. This brings me back to traditional govs like the US.

955110253380755458.text: If the miners are the only taxable entities, they’re likely to be taxed heavily in order to sustain a gov. So they mostly stay out.

955110251564584962.text: The people & businesses who still don’t want to be taxed may move to crypto citadels where only the miners are taxed. But why would miners domicile in those countries if they are the only ones taxed?

955110250130030592.text:
You may not even want to - you want it on public record that you own your property, and you want the gov backing you up. 

Secure ownership of property is one of the single biggest drivers of successful economies.

955110248611811328.text: On the individual side, taxes shift away from sales & income tax, toward higher property tax. People will still own houses and other real assets, and you can’t hide that from the gov as easily.

955110245268901889.text: The business is taxed on goods they produce, and they receive income from consumer purchases, which may or may not be traceable, but the gov doesn’t worry about it.

955110242907578369.text: What if the US gov takes the opposite route and embraces cryptocurrncies? Shift taxes toward a VAT model for businesses. I think it’s unlikely for businesses to go completely underground, just not as easy as it is for an individual.

321471527671447552.text:
Me- "Jackie Robinson was the first black man to play Major League Baseball."

Shelby- "I thought that was Babe Ruth?"

#huh. @shelbydjones

309466360218546177.text: Anybody want to go to Destin next week? Have an open spot in our condo. Let me know if you're interested.

281601980684722177.text: Just caught @Neu_MAN beatboxing by himself. He replied "I'm not sure if you were aware, but I'm pretty good." #white

225167096445800448.text: Always fun realizing as you leave work that they've turned the escalators back on for the people coming in the next day

207177509056425985.text: Long distance pizza delivery service, next stop: Houston

198415523166420992.text: That moment of triumph when you finally get something out of your teeth that you had been working at for 2 hours

198173461246525440.text: Library walking - it's like mall walking, but you only do it when you've been sitting in the same chair for 4 hours.

177796065213419520.text: The tale of 7 men and 2 tagalongs in their epic struggle to defend their home against General JPMorgan Chase. Movie gold. #SaveTheAlamo

150827535050088448.text: “@a_boaz: First Christmas Present! pic.twitter.com/i7sjsRus” You got a baby for Christmas?! #surprise! #surprise? #...crapwhatdoidowiththis

149210416852119552.text: 719-266-2837. Call it to make your day awesome. So awesome this tweet doesn't even need a hashtag.

148956448381075456.text: Decided to do Insanity. Immediately regretted the decision. #arbitrator #cardiacarrest

147199860410556416.text: You could make your accounting problems fun! Change words around like "So and so gets this many skittles..." #hayleycomment @hayley_lyddon

142073538470346752.text: The parking block from hell claims another victim. #wellwouldyalookatthatpic.twitter.com/tjgOJtFM

140625998273196033.text: “@RudyGranaghan: Mississippi State end zone has #HAILSTATE. What has social media done to this world...” Pot calling the kettle black #irony

128244367596072960.text: The TCU app needs a "Library Temperature" section, so I can base what I wear on if they have it set at "Volcano Hot" or "Arctic Freezing".

124892085873684480.text: Going to visit Randy Lewis, bringing along Good Night Moon to see if he'll read it to me as a bedtime story. #voiceofgold

123194515745013760.text: "Texas is better than Kansas because Texas could succeed from the US if it wanted to." #secede #shesathinker @shelbydjones

118454436770222081.text: Coopers - “@SkashAttack: What doesn't get better with the addition of the word miniature? #Poodles #CinnamonRolls #Golf #Giraffes”

116938459599474688.text: Just remembered the hidden fruit snacks I put in my backpack the other day as a nice surprise for myself. #BestIdeaEver

115520012764184576.text: I hate it when you're sitting down resting your feet on a table and it keeps slowly moving out from under you. #firstworldproblems

109080617660067840.text: The Alamo: attempting the impossible since 1836. #comeandtakeit http://yfrog.com/hsv3jyqj

106011132921249792.text: My cost accounting teacher is currently playing Smash Mouth "All-Star" over the speakers before class starts. #PumpUpMusic?

104199982877392896.text: Be prepared, Alamo, General Neuman and his army are invading. #IsThatThePizzaDeliveryGuy? @g_luke @will_jung4 http://yfrog.com/h6gr5zkj

103533099035525120.text: Back in the land of the free and the home of the Chiefs. #rebuildingyear

103477026903703552.text: Plane delayed because they can't get the weight balanced correctly. Not the best thing to hear when you're in the plane. #bedsidemanner

101665273383354368.text: Is this what the elevation signs look like all the time on South route? Must be nice. @Matt_Riesen http://yfrog.com/hsk9qaesj

101349397677346816.text: @AdamDaneWilson I guess I havent quite worked up the weight of a pro moon lander like you

101340180182597634.text: Am I in the cool club now? #dangerzone @AdamDaneWilson @RudyGranaghan http://yfrog.com/kkfy8qj

100201017169297408.text: I think I just got shot at by a hillbilly. #ItsTheAppalachiansBaby

99936897731805185.text: Going to Olive Garden for dinner. Chances are we'll still be eating sloppy joes. #extrasloppy

98898602461626371.text: Dont want to pay for a flu vaccine? Go to Cedar Point and run your hands along the handrails for free! #MaximumImmuneBoosting #HomeRemedy

98876010178686977.text: Seagulls fighting over food at Cedar Point. "The Hulk" throwing his weight around. #bully #AlmostBetterThanACoaster http://yfrog.com/klb2ielj

98573363106156545.text: Just got a professional massage. Really hard not to laugh, definitely lost it when she got to my feet. #ticklish #kindofawkward

96416321717284866.text: Fireworks and a 50 year old Black Eyed Peas wannabe band on the Navy Pier. @rossvanzandt #realwinners #midlifecrisis http://yfrog.com/gyur9dazj

96245773401997312.text: Spragoo's mom just showed up out of the blue at the random Target we're all at. #helicopter #CanSheApparate?

95687059418787840.text: Eating Wisconsin cheese curds at Culver's. #weirdaccent #webeatthem #GoFrogs

93730466368196609.text: Staying in a hotel and we don't have to share a bed with another guy. What? #separationanxiety

92934658148409344.text: Entire team is searching for the lost keys to crew van 2. Checking vans, lodging, and bags. #TSAempathy #johproblems

87284599792730112.text: Sprinted 40 miles to beat a "physically impossible" rack point on the way from Steamboat to Winter Park. #impossibleisnothing

85359324624457728.text: Best biscuits and gravy ever at sponsored Whole Foods breakfast. #FOFREE #GoBuffz
